name: combine harvesting | combine harvesting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20438/documentation

This dataset represents an example of a typical combine harvesting.The functional unit (FU) is one ha harvested. The operation time is 0.25 h/FU and the fuel consumption is 26 liters per hour. This is a common operation in grain production in Brazil.

From agricultural field foreseen to be processed.

The dataset includes the diesel fuel consumption and the amount of agricultural machinery and of the shed attributed to harvesting. It was also taken into consideration the amount of emissions to the air from combustion and the emission to the soil from tyre abrasion during the work process. The following activities where considered part of the work process: preliminary work at the farm, such as attaching the adequate machine to the tractor; field work (for a parcel of land of 1 ha surface); and concluding work, like uncoupling the machine. The overlapping during the field work is considered. The dataset doesn't include the grain production, straw treatment, dust other than from combustion and noise.This activity ends with the delivery of harvesting by combined harvester.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Most of the data used to modelling this activity were collected in the last few years (2012-2016).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for agricultural processes in Brazil.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Fuel consumption has been extrapolated to Brazil, but emissions per kg diesel and others inputs were taken from the original values.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Dataset based on CA-QC dataset which was extrapolated from CH geography context with modification of exchanges. Processes are typical procedures for Switzerland around the year 2000,  they are not statistical average processes. This dataset has been adapted only for diesel input representative of the Brazil context and for combustion emissions scaled from the difference in diesel consumption. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Emissions of CO, HC and NOx are expert estimations based on measurements for comparable activities (roling). The other emissions were calculated basing on literature data and the measured fuel consumption. The main source of data for diesel consumption are projects conducted by Embrapa Soja (CNPSO). Data are also provided by relevant experts related to agricultural sector in Brazil.

flow.name: combine harvesting
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description: Proxy, based on 'Agricultural Field Work Processes' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/talk-pages). Emission to soil from tyre abrasion, not related to diesel combustion. The same emission factor as the CA-QC dataset is used as a proxy.
